get.description: Retrieve insight-specific details and transaction and account data responsible for the triggered balances insight of the given type and ID.
Retrieve insight-specific details and transaction and account data responsible for the triggered income insight of the given type and ID.
Retrieve insight-specific details and transaction and account data responsible for the triggered income insight of the given type and ID.
List the matching components which can be used to define custom insights.

name.description: Name of the component, for creating an insight using it.

min.description: The minimum value accepted for this parameter, if any.

max.description: The maximum value accepted for this parameter, if any.

default.description: The default value for this parameter if unspecified.

components.name: expenditure_merchant
components.description: Tests whether the total spend, over a period, across a list of merchants, is at least an amount

components.name: income_l2s
components.description: Tests whether total income, over a period, across a list of L2 categories, is at least an amount

components.name: income_l3s
components.description: Tests whether total income, over a period, across a list of L3 categories, is at least an amount

components.name: expenditure_l2s
components.description: Tests whether the total spend, over a period, across a list of L2 categories, is at least an amount

components.name: expenditure_l3s
components.description: Tests whether the total spend, over a period, across a list of L3 categories, is at least an amount

post.description: Create new custom insights using one or more components.

name.description: The name to assign to this segment of users.

description.description: An optional human-readable description of the insight.

name.description: The name of the component to incorporate in the insight.

parameters.description: The parameters you want to specify for the component from its component spec. All are optional and if omitted the default value is used.

example.name: Life Insurance
example.description: Customer is paying more than bank X's average life insurance cost

insight_id.description: The ID of the created insight.

get.description: Compare a customer with an previously created custom insight, testing whether they match against it.

name.description: The name assigned to this segment of users.

description.description: An optional human-readable description of the insight.

components.description: The result of comparing the customer against each configured component of this insight, keyed by component configuration IDs.

match.description: Whether the customer matched this component.

value.description: A component-specific computed value for this customer, that either matched or failed to match the components's requirements. Meaning varies by component.

match.description: Whether this customer fully, partially, or not at all matched this insight. Full means matching all components, partial means matching at least one.

data.name: Life Insurance
data.description: Customer is paying more than bank X's average life insurance cost

get.description:
Provides a list of potential scenarios where a customer might suffer some financial expense that cover the following:

> ❗️ Deprecation:
>
> Support will cease for this endpoint on the 1st of December 2023 - please complete your migration to the Retrieve Actionable Insights endpoints by that point in time. For further details, contact your Bud account manager or email help@thisisbud.com.

| Money Management                | Description                                                                            |
|:--------------------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `overdraft`                     | Account is overdrawn (note that credit cards will not trigger this warning). |
| `cannot_cover_bills`            | The total upcoming payments for exceeds the current balance. The time range used for analysing past payments is `(X-From, X-Today)` and the period used for predicting upcoming payments is `(X-Today, X-To)`. |
| `late_income`                   | A regular incoming payment was expected to be received on the account and hasn't yet. |
| `late_payment`                  | A regular outgoing payment that was expected to come out of the account on a specific date but has been paid after expected date.  |
| `regular_payment_changed`       | The value of a regular payment has increased or decreased between the oldest and newest instance. |
| `suspected_duplicate_charge`    | A duplicate transaction is one of more transactions that are debit transactions, have a non-zero booking time, and have a non-zero amount. They must also have matching `account_id`, `transaction_reference`, `merchant_id` (if one exists), `amount`, `currency`, `date`, `booking_datetime`. |
| `regular_monthly_income_change` | The value of a regular income has increased or decreased based on the previous months income. As this is comparing income over whole months, only complete months are considered in the provided date range. For instance, if `X-From=2022-01-05` and `X-To=2022-04-05` then the range considered by this warning will be `(2022-01-01, 2022-03-31)`. In addition, the default treshold for a difference in amounts to trigger this warning is 10%. |

parameters.name: X-Today
parameters.description: Date (YYYY-MM-DD) to treat as the current day. Use this with `X-From` and `X-To` to find historical warnings (e.g. warnings that you would have received last week)

data.title: Money Management Response
data.description:
| Money Management                | Description                                                                            |
|:--------------------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `overdraft`                     | Account is overdrawn (note that credit cards will not trigger this warning). |
| `cannot_cover_bills`            | The total upcoming payments for exceeds the current balance. The time range used for analysing past payments is `(X-From, X-Today)` and the period used for predicting upcoming payments is `(X-Today, X-To)`. |
| `late_income`                   | A regular incoming payment was expected to be received on the account and hasn't yet. |
| `late_payment`                  | A regular outgoing payment that was expected to come out of the account on a specific date but has been paid after expected date. |
| `regular_payment_changed`       | The value of a regular payment has increased or decreased between the oldest and newest instance. |
| `suspected_duplicate_charge`    | A duplicate transaction is one of more transactions that are debit transactions, have a non-zero booking time, and have a non-zero amount. They must also have matching `account_id`, `transaction_reference`, `merchant_id` (if one exists), `amount`, `currency`, `date`, `booking_datetime`. |
| `regular_monthly_income_change` | The value of a regular income has increased or decreased based on the previous months income. As this is comparing income over whole months, only complete months are considered in the provided date range. For instance, if `X-From=2022-01-05` and `X-To=2022-04-05` then the range considered by this warning will be `(2022-01-01, 2022-03-31)`. In addition, the default treshold for a difference in amounts to trigger this warning is 10%. |

type.description: Money Management responses returned by API endpoint.

account_id.description: ID of the account that is overdrawn.

allOf.description: Amount the account is overdrawn by.

account_id.description: A unique identifier for the Customer bank account

allOf.description: Total predicted amount expected to be spent (i.e. the total of all upcoming debit transaction amounts).

account_id.description: A unique identifier for the Customer bank account

description.description: The raw transaction reference e.g. "bank transfer"

provider.description: The name of the relevant provider relevant to the source of the original transaction data

date.description: The timestamp of when the transaction is expected to be booked in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`

label.description: The recurring transaction group identifier associating one set of regular transactions e.g. all Spotify transactions that are regular by the same monthly period will share the same label. This label comes from the group used to predict this upcoming transaction.

credit_debit_indicator.description: Indication as to whether the transaction was a credit or debit

category_l1.description: The name of the category returned by the Bud categorisation model.

category_l2.description: The name of the subcategory returned by the Bud categorisation model.

category_l3.description: The name of the 3rd level category returned by the Bud categorisation model.

allOf.description: The current balance of the account

credit_debit_indicator.description: Indication as to whether the transaction was a credit or debit

account_id.description: ID of the account that has not received its income yet.

label.description: The recurring transaction group identifier associating one set of regular transactions e.g. all Salary transactions that are regular by the same monthly period will share the same label.

expected_date.description: Expected date of payment in ISO8601 format.

days_late.description: Number of days that the transaction is late by.

merchant.title: Bud Merchant Object
merchant.description: Details regarding a merchant associated with a transaction

name.description: Display name for the detected merchant

logo.description: URL for logo of the detected merchant

category_l1.description: The name of the category returned by the Bud categorisation model.

category_l2.description: The name of the subcategory returned by the Bud categorisation model.

category_l3.description: The name of the 3rd level category returned by the Bud categorisation model.

anyOf.title: Late Payment Warning Details
anyOf.description: Triggered when a payment has not been made by predicted date.

account_id.description: ID of the account from where the income is expected to be debited.

label.description: The recurring transaction group identifier associating one set of regular transactions e.g. all "Spotify" transactions that are regular by the same monthly period will share the same label.

expected_date.description: Expected date of payment in ISO8601 format.

days_late.description: Number of days that the transaction is late by.

category_l1.description: The name of the category returned by the Bud categorisation model.

category_l2.description: The name of the subcategory returned by the Bud categorisation model.

category_l3.description: The name of the 3rd level category returned by the Bud categorisation model.

account_id.description: Unique identifier of the account that the regular payment is made from.

provider.description: Banking provider the account exists with.

regular_payment_label.description: The recurring transaction group identifier associating one set of regular transactions e.g. all "Spotify" transactions that are regular by the same monthly period will share the same label.

description.description: The description of the latest transaction of the regular payments group.

change.description: To denote whether the change in the amount associated with the regular payment has increased or decreased.

allOf.description: The difference in the transaction amount between latest transaction and the previous transaction.

transactions.description: The transactions making up this group of regular payments.

account_id.description: The unique identifier of the account associated with the transaction.

date.description: The date of the transaction in YYYY-MM-DD format.

label.description: The recurring transaction group identifier associating one set of regular transactions e.g. all "Spotify" transactions that are regular by the same monthly period will share the same label.

credit_debit_indicator.description: Indicates whether the transaction is a credit or a debit entry.

l1_category_name.description: The name of the category returned by the Bud categorisation model.

l2_category_name.description: The name of the subcategory returned by the Bud categorisation model.

l3_category_name.description: The name of the 3rd level category returned by the Bud categorisation model.

account_id.description: The unique identifier of the account associated with the transaction.

date.description: The date of the transaction in YYYY-MM-DD format.

label.description: The recurring transaction group identifier associating one set of regular transactions e.g. all "Spotify" transactions that are regular by the same monthly period will share the same label.

credit_debit_indicator.description: Indicates whether the transaction is a credit or a debit entry.

merchant.title: Bud Merchant Object
merchant.description: Details regarding a merchant associated with a transaction

name.description: Display name for the detected merchant

logo.description: URL for logo of the detected merchant

l1_category_name.description: The name of the category returned by the Bud categorisation model.

l2_category_name.description: The name of the subcategory returned by the Bud categorisation model.

l3_category_name.description: The name of the 3rd level category returned by the Bud categorisation model.

anyOf.title: Regular Monthly Income Changed Warning Details

month.description: The current month used in calculations, in `YYYY-MM` format.

allOf.description: The total income identified in the previous month.
The total income identified in the current month.

proportion_change.description:
The difference between the previous month's and the current month's income as a decimal rounded to 2 decimal places e.g. `"0.51"`. 
If there is no income in one of the months, it is not possible to calculate the value so it is set to `null`.

get.description:
Provides a list of potential scenarios where a customer might suffer some financial expense that cover the following:

> ❗️ Deprecation:
>
> Support will cease for this endpoint on the 1st of December 2023 - please complete your migration to the Retrieve Customer Characteristics endpoints by that point in time. For further details, contact your Bud account manager or email help@thisisbud.com.

| Customer Characteristics             | Description |
|:---------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `parent`             | User has childcare transactions |
| `student_loan`       | User is paying off a student loan |
| `pensioner`          | User receives pension income |                                                 
| `saver`              | User receives savings income and / or deposits money into a savings / investment account |
| `insurer`            | User has one or more insurance policies |
| `overdraft_user`     | User was in their overdraft at midnight on any day during a set period|
| `cash_user`          | User has made cash deposits and / or cash withdrawals |
| `subscriber`         | User has one or more subscriptions|

data.title: Customer Characteristic Response
data.description:
| Customer Characteristics             | Description |
|:---------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `parent`             | User has childcare transactions |
| `student_loan`       | User is paying off a student loan |
| `pensioner`          | User receives pension income |                                                 
| `saver`              | User receives savings income and / or deposits money into a savings / investment account |
| `insurer`            | User has one or more insurance policies |
| `overdraft_user`     | User was in their overdraft at midnight on any day during a set period|
| `cash_user`          | User has made cash deposits and / or cash withdrawals |
| `subscriber`         | User has one or more subscriptions|

get.description:
Provides a list of potential scenarios where a customer might suffer some financial expense that cover the following:

> ❗️ Deprecation:
>
> Support will cease for this endpoint on the 1st of December 2023 - please complete your migration to the Retrieve Actionable Insights endpoints by that point in time. For further details, contact your Bud account manager or email help@thisisbud.com.

 | Financial Insights   | Description                                                                            |
 |:---------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
 | `gambling_income`             | Income indentified through gambling transactions |
 | `pension_income`              | Income indentified through company pension(s) |
 | `gambling_threshold`          | Overall spending on gambling exceeds the threshold (default to 20%) of all income over that same time period |                                                                 
 | `new_insurance_expense`       | Any new insurance related expense identified |
 | `subscription_expense`        | Any new subscription related expense identified  |

data.title: Customer Characteristic Response
data.description:
| Financial Insights   | Description                                                                            |
|:---------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `gambling_income`             | Income indentified through gambling transactions |
| `pension_income`              | Income indentified through company pension(s) |
| `gambling_threshold`          | Overall spending on gambling exceeds the threshold (defaults to 20%) of all income over that same time period |
| `new_insurance_expense`       | Any new insurance related expense identified |
| `subscription_expense`        | Any new subscription related expense identified |

allOf.description: List of merchants associated to pension transactions
List of merchants associated to pension transactions

threshold.description: The fraction of income needed to spend on gambling to trigger the warning, formatted as a decimal numeric string

ratio_to_income.description:
The ratio of gambling expenditure to income over the period. 
If there is no income in one of the months, it is not possible to calculate the value so it is set to `null`.

transaction_id.description: A unique identifier for the transaction

account_id.description: A unique identifier for the Customer bank account

description.description: The raw transaction reference e.g. "bank transfer"

booking_datetime.description: The timestamp of when the transactions was booked in ISO 8601/RFC 3339 format e.g. `"2022-06-10T15:30:02Z"`

credit_debit_indicator.description: Indication as to whether the transaction was a credit or debit

allOf.description: List of merchants associated to pension transactions
Total amount of subscription related expenses.

get.description:
Provides the key trends associated with a customer’s transactional data broken down by month

> ❗️ Deprecation:
>
> Support will cease for this endpoint on the 1st of December 2023 - please complete your migration to the Retrieve Category Totals V2 endpoints by that point in time. For further details, contact your Bud account manager or email help@thisisbud.com.

parameters.name: X-Client-Id
parameters.description: The API Client Identifier (Service Application Identifier).

parameters.name: X-Customer-Secret
parameters.description: The Bud Customer secret used to encrypt customer data. This is optional only if the customer secret is already stored with Bud (i.e. the `host_secret` was set to `true` in the Customer Context when the customer was created).

parameters.name: X-From
parameters.description: Month (`YYYY-MM`) from which the transactions should be returned from, this works in pair with the `X-To` parameter.

parameters.name: X-To
parameters.description: Month (`YYYY-MM`) from which the transactions should be returned to, this works in pair with the `X-From` parameter.

data.title: Trends Response
data.description: Each key/value pair represents a month and the totals for that month. The keys will be of the form `YYYY-MM` for each month totalled.

categories.description: A spending breakdown of each category. Each key name corresponds to the category name.

allOf.description: Total credited in the account in the category
Total debited in the account in the category

subcategories.description: A breakdown of each subcategory. Each key corresponds to the subcategory name.

allOf.description: Total credited in the account in the subcategory
Total debited in the account in the subcategory

results.description: Number of transactions that were totalled over.

metadata.title: Trends Response Metadata
metadata.description: Any relevant metadata associated wih the response from the Retrieve Trends endpoint

400.description: Bad Request that fails validations on headers & payload

401.description: Unauthorized (BearerToken in 'Authorization' header fails the authentication)

5XX.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server side

get.description:
Provides a list of the regular and predicted transactions over a given period, noting whether they are booked, pending or predicted.

> ❗️ Deprecation:
>
> Support will cease for this endpoint on the 1st of December 2023 - please complete your migration to the Retrieve Forecasted Transactions V2 endpoints by that point in time. For further details, contact your Bud account manager or email help@thisisbud.com.

parameters.name: X-From
parameters.description: Date (YYYY-MM-DD) from which the transactions should be returned from, this works in pair with the 'X-To' parameter

parameters.name: X-To
parameters.description: Date (YYYY-MM-DD) from which the transactions should be returned to, this works in pair with the 'X-From' parameter

parameters.name: X-Delta
parameters.description: Number of days error to match regular payments when they could be off by a few days from month to month. E.g. if your predicted rent payment is on `25th` but you paid it on `23rd`, a delta of `2` would treat your predicted transaction for `25th` as `Booked/Pending`.

items.title: Forecasted Transaction
items.description: Transaction object for the financial assistant forecast response

transaction_id.description:
ID of the transaction if it is `Booked` or `Pending`. This will be empty if it corresponds to a predicted transaction 
that has not yet been seen on the account.

label.description: Grouping label for the transaction if it is detected as a regular transaction.

credit_debit_indicator.description: Indication as to whether the transaction was a credit or debit

date.description: Date (or predicted date) of the transaction in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

metadata.title: Forecasted Metadata
metadata.description: Metadata object for the financial assistant forecast response
